pullRequest.title: Rename CUSTOM_PME_PARAMETERS to ALIGNMENT_PARAMETERS, add endpoint fo…
pullRequest.bodyText:
…r retrieving default alignment parameters for build types
Checklist:

 Have you added a note in the CHANGELOG wiki for your change if user-facing?
 Have you added unit tests for your change?

nodes.bodyText: Document the expected values in the Map, please.

We store the generic parameters as a single String in the DB and also will provide it as one String in the UI.
I think is should be just a Map<String, String>.
"set in resource config file" - it is implementation detail, which shouldn't be on the REST API. The important information is, that these strings are the default params.

beforeCommit.message: Rename CUSTOM_PME_PARAMETERS to ALIGNMENT_PARAMETERS, add endpoint for retrieving default alignment parameters for build types

afterCommit.message: Rename CUSTOM_PME_PARAMETERS to ALIGNMENT_PARAMETERS, add endpoint for retrieving default alignment parameters for build types

nodes.bodyText: I think it should be: according to a build type chosen by a user

nodes.bodyText: CUSTOM_PROJECT_MANIPULATOR_PARAMETERS should have been removed as ALIGNMENT_PARAMETERS replaces it, right?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@
 # limitations under the License.
 #
 
-CUSTOM_PME_PARAMETERS=Additional parameters, which will be passed to the PME CLI executable during the alignment before the build. The format is as you would enter them on a command line, and each MUST start with a dash.
+ALIGNMENT_PARAMETERS=Additional parameters, which will be passed to the PME CLI executable during the alignment before the build. The format is as you would enter them on a command line, and each MUST start with a dash.
 BREW_BUILD_NAME=Specify the Brew build name of the build configuration. This is used to override the default value, and can be useful for builds that disable PME. For Maven builds the format should be '<groupid>:<artifactid>'.
 CUSTOM_PROJECT_MANIPULATOR_PARAMETERS=Additional parameters, which will be passed to the Project Manipulator CLI executable during the alignment (NPM, etc, non-Maven projects) before the build. The format is as you would enter them on a command line, and each MUST start with a dash.
